title: Oliver Cromwell's letters and speeches: with elucidations.
author: Cromwell, Oliver
snippet: St.John's Suburb lies at some distance from Worcester ; west, orsouthwest as we say, on the Hertfordshire Road ; and connectsitself with the City by Severn Bridge. Southeast of the City,again, near the then and present London Road, is ' Sort Royal,'an entrenchment of the Scots : on this side Cromwell is to attemptthe Enemy, and second Fleetwood, as occasion may serve. Worcester City itself is on Cromwell's side of the River ; stands high,

title: Over-Sea; or, England, France and Scotland as seen by a live American ... With numerous illustrations, etc
author: Morford, Henry.
snippet: My own land, nearlyfour thousand miles away, was to make itself felt and remembered, even amid the notaole in Old World art and nature. I was descending the hill, past that spot on the Southern side,between the London Road and Waterloo Place, where thenoble pile of the Royal High-School now marks the siteonce occupied by the Kirk of Fieid (or Church in the Fields)in which Queen Mary's worthless husband, Darnley, wasblown up and murdered in February, 1567 ;—past the handsome little Burns Monument, a pillared Grecian temple onbase, with winged griffins supporting an hour-glass ;—pastthe Prison of Edinboro', embattled with more than forty turrets, and notably handsome (to those who only see it fromthe outside .')—when I saw something fluttering up the flagstaff Jo. the Royal Hotel, down Prince's Street, and recognized, for the first time in weeks, the starry flag which hadso lately been raised anew over the last strong-hold of rebellion !
